greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of C(3), where C(x) = -Sum_{k>=1} (-1)^k/prime(k)^x.
comment: The alternating series of reciprocal powers of prime numbers converges for any x > 0 (absolutely so if x > 1) but is hard to compute.
The next digits of C(3), after ...91124, seem to converge to a(20)=9, a(21)=0.
After ...9033139246557, the next digit, a(33), seems likely to be 7 or 8. - _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Dec 28 2017
link: S. Sykora, PARI/GP scripts for primes-related functions, see function AltSum1DivPrimePwr(x,eps), with instruction
results.author: _Stanislav Sykora_, May 14 2014
